plan: My strategies will firstly include low-risk testing, bidding lower values to gather information about opponent habits. Afterward, I'll test aggressive strategies, bidding high when my value is high, aiming to maximize potential profits. I will also consider proportionate bidding, where I bid proportionate to my value. Throughout, I'll monitor and adjust my strategy based on the observed bidding patterns of Betty and Charles, and the profitability of my own bids.

I will test two key strategies next. First, the aggressive approach, consistently bidding high to win the auction (80-100% of value). This helps me understand high-profit potential. Second, I will adopt a conservative strategy, bidding low (~40% of value). This allows me to amass profit slowly, chances are high to lose but I don't lose too much. I will also analyze losses and winnings from previous bids to understand competition behaviour, adjusting my strategies accordingly while randomizing bids occasionally to throw off opponents. This extensive testing helps in devising the most profitable strategy moving forward.

Initial rounds will involve exploratory bidding to identify competitors' average range. Bids will incrementally increase, alongside aggressively high bids occasionally to determine upper limit thresholds. Following rounds will incorporate risk-adjusted strategies, leveraging learnings from previous rounds. The strategy can involve bidding low when the value is low and slightly above average when the value is high. As the game progresses, the strategy may adapt to more aggressive, risky bidding to potentially maximize profit.

Plan to incrementally raise my bids in next rounds to study opponents' tendencies. I will bid higher when my value is high, and moderate for low values, observing profits against aggressive and conservative strategies

Plan to rotate between aggressive bidding (80-100% of value) to grasp high-profit potential and conservative bidding (~40% of value) for gradual profit. Analyze round history to adjust strategies, incorporate random bids to confuse opponents. Aim to optimize profit by learning from past results.

I plan to increase my bid to discover the upper limit of bids, using occasional aggressive high bids. My bid will relate to my value, generally bidding low on low values, but above average on high values, adapting strategy as we progress.

In the next round, I'll test a high-risk strategy and bid near the upper limit of my value. I'll also test the reaction when bidding minimally during low-value sessions, to understand opponents' tendencies and adjust my strategy accordingly.

I will adopt a mixed strategy, employing aggressive bids (80-100% of value) in some rounds and conservative bids (~40% of value) in others, also incorporating unexpected bid rates to confuse competitors while optimizing long-term profits based on round history learning.

Plan to explore a mix of conservative and moderately high bids based on value. If value is low, try a low bid. If high, bid moderately above average. This allows for further data collection while managing risk.

Next, I plan to test moderate bidding relative to my value during high-value sessions, and slight bidding during low-value sessions. I aim to balance risk, while learning about my opponents' tendencies.

To maximize profit, I will cycle between low-risk bids (~40% of value) and high-risk bids (80-100% of value). Analyzing competitors' strategies from past rounds and introducing unpredictable bids will also be part of my approach.

Next, I will randomize my bids within a range based on past highest bids to evaluate bidding dynamics. Similarly, I'll intertwine lower than average bids to assess potential profits when other bidders possibly overbid. Analyzing these results will guide future strategy development.

Plan to divide my value evenly between low-risk and high-reward bids. Test borderline bids in high-value situations. Maintain low bidding pattern for low values, offering contrast data. Analyze bid effectiveness against varying competitor strategies.

I plan to proceed with an experimental bidding strategy, rotating between high-risk, aggressive bids (80-100% of value) and more conservative, low-risk bids (~40% of value). Periodic random bids will be included to keep competitors off-balance while gradually optimizing my overall profit based on learned strategies.

Next, I'll incorporate calculated risk-taking in my strategy. Alternate between bidding slightly lower on lower-values and significantly high for higher-values. Additionally, threading in an occasional aggressive high-bid irrespective of the value to test opponent's thresholds.

I'll explore middle-ground bidding, to balance risk-reward. If my value is high, I'll bid around 70-80%. For low values, I'll conservatively bid 30-40% of my value. This aims to maximize long-term profits without risking too much.

Next round, I plan to evenly distribute between aggressive (80-100% of value) bids and conservative (~40% of value) bids. Based on previous rounds, I'll also incorporate unpredictable bid rates, and adapt strategies for long-term profit maximization.

Plan to balance low-bid strategies on lower values and aggressive high-bids on higher values. Intermittently, bid significantly high irrespective of my value. Neutralize risks by bidding near the average of highest bids from previous rounds to explore possible winning thresholds.

Next, I'll focus on precision bidding. For high values, I'll aim to bid about 80-90% of my value. For lower values, I'll bid approximately half. This strategy seeks to maximize potential gains while limiting risk.

I will continue alternating between high-risk aggressive bids (80-100% of value) and low-risk conservative bids (~40% of my value). Additionally, I'll intersperse random bids for unpredictability, studying and learning from past patterns to maximize long-term profitability.

For the upcoming rounds, I'll pursue a mixed strategic approach, incorporating random high bids, and low bids based on low values. I will occasionally venture into extremely high bids, even with low values, to assess opponents' exploring limits.

I'll test a lower risk strategy, bidding about 75% on high values and close to 50% on lower values. This allows room for profit while remaining competitive in the auction, based on prior rounds' outcomes.

I'll strategize my bids between aggressive (80-100% of value) and conservative (40% of value) styles, introducing sporadic, unpredictable bids. Analyzing competitors' bidding tactics from past round results to optimize my long-term profit strategy.

I'll aim to bid near the high-end of previous winning bids for high values and apply lower bids for lower values. Intermittently, I'll place significantly high or extremely low bids regardless of value for exploration, adjusting approach based on resulting profit patterns.

I'll experiment with incremental precision bidding, approximating around 85% on high values, and near 50% on lower ones. This aims to optimize profit while keeping competitiveness based on analyzed auction trends.

For next rounds, I'm alternating between aggressive (80-100% of value) and conservative (~40% of value) bids. Unpredictable bids will be introduced occasionally to throw off opponents while constantly learning from historical patterns for long-term profit maximization.

Going forward, I'll continue strategically mixing low/high bids adjusting with value. Implement dynamically, sprinkling a few surprising high bids, potentially pushing established boundaries, while bidding conservatively low on lesser values to conserve profits. Observations and analysis from these approaches will help refine the ongoing strategy.

I plan to implement a dynamic strategy. For higher values, I may bid 75-85% to secure a win and reap profits. For lower values, I plan to test frugal bidding, around 30-40%, to minimize losses and maintain profitability. Adjustment depends on ongoing analysis of opponents' tendencies.

Next, I'll further refine bid adjustments between aggressive (80-100% of value) and conservative (40%) strategies, while adding more unpredictable bids. Additionally, I'll carefully study past patterns to optimize my bidding decisions and maximize long-term profits.

Next phase involves diversifying my strategies; low bids on low values, minimum aggressive high-bids on high values, occasional aggressive bids and statistical bids around the average of winning bids to gauge thresholds without significantly impeding potential profits.

Next, I'll continue dynamic bidding, adjusting based on my value. For high values, I'll bid 70-85% of my value. If the value is low, I'll bid 20-40%. This strategy aims to maintain competitiveness and profitability while minimizing potential losses.

I'll apply a dynamic strategy, shifting between aggressive (80-100% of value) and conservative bids (40%), with sporadic unexpected bids. Past auction histories will guide my future strategies, ensuring long-term profit maximization. I'll also test the impact of marginally lower bids to optimize profit.

Will employ adaptive bidding – low bids on low value draws and approximations of winners' average bid for higher values. Occasionally, disruptive high bids might be placed for learning effects. Continuous analysis of outcomes will inform further refinement in strategies for profit maximization.

Next, I'll test a moderate-risk strategy, bidding around 60-70% of high values, maintain 40% for low values. Also, I'll observe reaction to occasional outlier bids. This helps balance profitability risks while investigating competitors' adaptability, enhancing the understanding of the auction scenario.

I'll conduct bid intervals between aggressive (80-100% of value) and conservative bids (40% of value). Erratic bids will be introduced for unpredictability. Using previous bid patterns, I'll adjust strategy for long-term profits. I'll also slightly modify my bids to explore potential gain areas.

Continue adaptive bidding using low bids for low values, near-average bids for high values. Introduce unpredictable bid pattern, occasionally mixing high-risk high bids irrespective of values, for strategic disruption. Analyze opponents’ reactions for gleaned insights to refine subsequent bidding strategies toward profit maximization.

I will explore implementing a conditional strategy, varying my bidding based on the opponents' prior habits. A pivot to higher bids for values above 50, around 80-90%, while maintaining a conservative 30-40% for lower values. Learning and capitalizing on competitors' behaviors will be a priority.

I will continue to mix aggressive (80-100% value) and conservative bids (40% value), introducing rare random bids. I will focus on marginally reducing bids from the previous winning bid, observing opponent's strategies, to enhance profit while maintaining auction wins.

I'll continue blending strategies - conservative bids for low values, closely mirroring average winning bids for higher values. Infrequent yet disruptive high bids to understand boundaries. Results analysis to hone profit-maximizing strategies.

For the next rounds, I'll increase my bidding to 85-95% for high values to enhance chances of winning. For low values, maintain a conservative 30-40% bid strategy. Additionally, introduce random high bids on mid-range values to examine opponents' reaction and adjust bidding pattern dynamically.

Next, I'll oscillate between aggressive bids (~80-100% of value) and conservative ones (~40% of value), adding rare unpredictable bids. I'll adjust these strategies by studying historical data, especially considering the range of losing bids to improve my winning chances while optimizing profitability.

To optimize profits, my plan involves testing split methods: lower than average bids for low values and moderately high bids for high values. Occasionally, I'll randomly pitch an overly high bid to see how it influences the game dynamics and extract insights for future bidding.

For high value prizes, I'll reduce my previous strategy to bid approximately 80-85% of value to conserve resources. For mid and low values, continue conservative 20-40% bidding. Introduce random high bids on mid-range values as a testing variable. Adjust strategy dynamically based on opponents' reactions and learned tendencies.

My strategy will be to test a 70-100% average aggressive bid for a chance to win higher values. Data from past rounds suggest this may increase profits. Unpredictability will still be introduced occasionally, adjusting my bids slightly lower than the highest winning bid previously.

Plan to pursue dynamic bidding pattern, varying between significant high bids and substantially low bids, irrespective of value. Employ disruptive, statistical average bids intermittently to understand competitors' thresholds for crafting refined, data-informed bidding strategies towards potential profit maximization.
